dateline.placeName: OFFICE OF ALL THE YEAR ROUND,

body.p: I will send you round the No doubt for All the Year Round, but not identified. concluding folios of the enclosed paper2 at about noon to day. Tomorrow morning I will begin to make up the Xmas No.Doctor Marigold’s Prescriptions, All the Year Round Xmas No., published 7 Dec 65. Birtles had by now received the first three stories (To Birtles, 7 Nov, Pilgrim Letters 11). CD “made up” the No. with another five stories, including his own “To Be Taken with a Grain of Salt” and “To be Taken for Life”; he then spent 8 Nov with Births, “making up” the No. for printing, “always a tough job” (To Lehmann, 7 Nov, Pilgrim Letters 11). Speed was essential: galley proofs had to be read and corrected, the rest of the MS typeset and finally the type broken up into double-column pages. The No. was in print by 17 Nov, when CD sent Charles Kent a confidential copy. and will enable you to go on breaking it into pages.
